results.title: Dionne quintuplets
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, Paul Wright, Peter Katadotis, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Back in 1934, Elzire Dionne delivered five identical girls. This documentary follows Cecile, Emilie, Marie, Yvonne and Annette through twenty one years of strange upbringing. When the girls were just infants, the premier of Ontario issued a court order removing them from their parent’s care. Cut off from the world and their family, over-publicised, viewed twice daily in a special viewing compound, they grew up as prize exhibits. Director Donald Brittain uses newsreel footage, home movie sequences and interviews to depict a historic event that became a tragic exploitation of a family.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Brittain, Paul Wright, Peter Katadotis, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Peach's Australia : The Dandenongs
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Peach’s Australia”.
The Dandenong’s are the lungs of Melbourne, and an enchanting weekend tourist resort with rare plant and animal life. Its charm is now being eroded by urban sprawl

results.title: Peach's Australia : Mount Buffalo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Peach’s Australia”.
It is the position of Mt Buffalo, standing apart from the Victorian Alps, and its extraordinary shape, that have led it to being called Australia’s grandest, wildest, most novel and most romantic mountain.

results.title: Peach's Australia: Arnhem Land
results.creator_credit: Stanley Moore, Bill Peach, David Roberts and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Popular former ABC TV personality Bill Peach travels the length and breadth of Australia seeking out often little known facets of the country’s history and their relation to present day conditions in the particular areas.
In this episode, Bill Peach explores Arnhem Land and it’s history, as seen by the Aboriginal people who live there. The program was filmed at the Gove, Elcho Island, Deaf Adder Gorge, Murganella and other places within the Kakadu National Park and includes a visit to the oldest rock paintings in Australia.

results.title: Dinosaur
results.creator_credit: Eric Leighton, Ralph Zondag, Pam Marsden and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Computer animated feature from Walt Disney Pictures, artfully combined live action backgrounds with CGI pre-historic beasts. This family oriented adventure movie is about an orphaned dinosaur raised by lemurs. Years later when the inhabitants flee the continent, Aladar, as he is known, encounters his own kind for the first time. The landmark animation of this feature was highly praised for its attention to detail and awe-inspiring aesthetics. Features the voices of D.B. Sweeney, Alfre Woodard, Ossie Davis, Max Casella, Hayden Panettiere, and Sam Wright.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Leighton, Ralph Zondag, Pam Marsden and Walt Disney Pictures

results.title: Dinosaur
results.creator_credit: Ralph Zondag, Eric Leighton, Pam Marsden and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Lavish Disney family movie, “Dinosaur” broke new ground with its awe-inspiring aesthetics of computer animation, set against live action backgrounds. The simplistic story is pure Disney - Aladar is an iguanodon snatched by a pterodactyl whilst still in the egg; the egg, via a range of predators and mishaps, makes a treacherous journey across land and sea until a clan of lemurs adopt the baby as one of their own; when a meteor shower rattles the inhabitants of the continent, they decide to flee; en route, Aladar experiences life with his own kind for the first time. The film entertains a gentle, traditional family brand of humour that supports the themes of compassion, friendship and tolerance with a gentle nod toward respecting one’s elders. The predictable narrative progression, a conventional quest that supports a basic morality of good triumphing over evil, is overcome by the impressive animation and stupendous set pieces.

results.title: Peach's Australia : Hahndorf
results.creator_credit: Bill Steller, Alan Bateman and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Peach’s Australia”.
Traces the history of the town of Hahndorf, South Australia, beginning with the German settlers who arrived at Port Misery (Port Adelaide) in 1838. Outlines their reasons for leaving Germany, the establishment of Klemzig, the movement of some Germans into the Adelaide Hills and the difficulties they encountered. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Peach's Australia : Murray Riverboats
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Peach’s Australia”.
The Murray River has many problems, including pollution, the dwindling of its native fish, and the introduction of the European Carp, but the biggest problem has been in the threatened loss of its history. To Bill Peach, “the riverboats represent the most colourful and romantic part of that history, and the skeletons of riverboats are symbols of our failure to love and care for our greatest river. Written and presented by Bill Peach.

results.title: Dimensions
results.creator_credit: Bernard Longpre, Jacques Bobet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film without words (with titles in French) in which simple actions achieve surprising results. A man wants a door in a wall; he draws a rectangle and, presto, there is an opening. In the same way, he conjures up furnishings. If too high or too low, a raising or lowering of a finger puts everything right. The film is a sort of lesson in proportions, which young viewers especially should enjoy. Cast: Paul Buissonneau, Louise Latraverse.
